materials.raw_text: Mo: 40 g, Nd: 10 g, O: 96 g, Pr: 5 g, Tb: 20 g

sourcing.instructions: Mo: Metal supplier, Nd: Rare earth material supplier, O: Chemical supplier, Pr: Rare earth material supplier, Tb: Rare earth material supplier
steps: Mo: Metal supplier, Nd: Rare earth material supplier, O: Chemical supplier, Pr: Rare earth material supplier, Tb: Rare earth material supplier

1. Weigh all materials accurately. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine 40 g of Mo, 10 g of Nd, 96 g of O, 5 g of Pr, and 20 g of Tb. 3. Mix thoroughly using a ceramic spatula or a glass rod until the mixture is homogeneous. 4. Transfer the mixture to a ball mill and mill for 2 hours to ensure uniform particle size.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh all materials accurately. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine 40 g of Mo, 10 g of Nd, 96 g of O, 5 g of Pr, and 20 g of Tb. 3. Mix thoroughly using a ceramic spatula or a glass rod until the mixture is homogeneous. 4. Transfer the mixture to a ball mill and mill for 2 hours to ensure uniform particle size.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the milled mixture in a high-temperature crucible suitable for metal oxides. 3. Heat the mixture for 4 hours at 1200째C to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the milled mixture in a high-temperature crucible suitable for metal oxides. 3. Heat the mixture for 4 hours at 1200째C to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.

steps: 1. After the heating period, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature inside the furnace for approximately 8 hours to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating period, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature inside the furnace for approximately 8 hours to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and carefully extract the solid sample. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with 400-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant if the material will be exposed to moisture.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and carefully extract the solid sample. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with 400-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant if the material will be exposed to moisture.
